str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular

str2: Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(lit: belonging to the city; then: witty, clever), elegant, pretty, fair, fine, beautiful. From astu; urbane, i.e. handsome.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A (lunar) month. A primary word; a month.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rear, bring up, nourish, educate. From ana and trepho; to rear.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
